intro: Elsholtzia manshurica, commonly known as the Manchurian elsholtzia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of northeastern China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite leaves that are often glandular and covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. Elsholtzia manshurica is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
